meanings.definition: Serving to explain or describe something
meanings.sent1: The teacher used an expositional video to help us understand the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The book had an expositional chapter that clarified the main character's motives.
meanings.sent3: The expositional diagram of the science experiment made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her expositional storytelling painted a vivid picture in our minds.
meanings.sent5: The expositional presentation was so clear that even a child could follow along.

meanings.sent1: The expositional materials at the museum explained the historical artifacts.
meanings.sent2: His expositional style in writing made complex ideas easy to grasp.
meanings.sent3: The expositional banners at the fair caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The expositional nature of the speech captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The expositional signs guided visitors through the exhibit seamlessly.

meanings.definition: Providing information or background on a topic
meanings.sent1: The expositional brochure gave details about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The documentary provided expositional context for the historical event.
meanings.sent3: The expositional trivia game was surprisingly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His expositional anecdotes added depth to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The expositional interview revealed fascinating insights about the author.
